intro: Polygala vulgaris var. elata, commonly known as the tall milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish, with a distinctive spurred structure that aids in pollination. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
